instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP1V35_CAM: What is PP1V35_CAM? PP1V35_CAM is a 1.35v power rail to power the webcam. .
definitions.PP1V8_CAM: What is PP1V8_CAM? PP1V8_CAM is a 1.8v power rail for powering the webcam.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with nonfunctional camera
threads.message:
This <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> arrived dead with liquid damage. I diagnosed a bad <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>, which I replaced. Everything is now functional except the webcam.

I tried 3 different display assemblies and display cables... no camera. Interestingly, Apple Diagnostics does NOT report any issues with the camera, but  System Report says "No video capture devices".

Ambient Light Sensor is fully functional. No green camera LED. I checked all 8 inductors on the <SIGNAL>MIPI_CLK</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>MIPI_DATA</SIGNAL> lines, they are all good.

During the board's power-up sequence I get all camera power rails (<SIGNAL>CAMERA_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP1V2_CAM</SIGNAL>,<SIGNAL>PP1V35_CAM</SIGNAL>,<SIGNAL>PP1V8_CAM</SIGNAL>). When I try to access the camera (Photo Booth app), <SIGNAL>CAMERA_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> goes high for half a second, then back to zero and the app reports "There is no connected camera".

Anything else I could try before assuming that the camera chip <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> or the SMC is damaged?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with nonfunctional camera
threads.message:
Check for corroded components around <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> & <CHIP>U4000</CHIP>.
Possibly broken traces; check continuity for corresponding J8500 lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with nonfunctional camera
threads.message: Nothing I could find. I confirmed <SIGNAL>5V_CAM</SIGNAL> on the TCON board. Could be a broken trace deep inside the board, but I can't check for continuity due to the underfill on <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> and <CHIP>U4000</CHIP>.
